org.criteria4jpa.projection
Class Projections

java.lang.Object
  org.criteria4jpa.projection.Projections

public class Projections
extends Object

Factory class for Projection instances that can be added to a criteria by calling Criteria.setProjection(Projection).

Author:
Christian Kaltepoth

Constructor Detail

Projections

public Projections()
Method Detail

distinct

public static Projection distinct(Projection projection)
Creates a "distinct" projection wrapping another projection.

Parameters:
projection - the projection to wrap with a "distinct"
Returns:
a new projection instance

projectionList

public static ProjectionList projectionList()
Creates a projection list projection that wraps a list if other projections. You may add projections to the list by calling ProjectionList.add(Projection) on the returned projection. If you use a projection list for your criteria, that query will return an object array.

Returns:
new instance of ProjectionList

property

public static Projection property(String relativePath)
This method only exists for compatibility with the Hibernate Criteria API and simply delegates the call to relativePath(String).

Parameters:
relativePath - relative path expression of a field
Returns:
new projection instance

groupProperty

public static Projection groupProperty(String relativePath)
This method only exists for compatibility with the Hibernate Criteria API and simply delegates the call to relativeGroupPath(String).

Parameters:
relativePath - relative path expression of a field
Returns:
new projection instance
Since:
0.3

relativePath

public static Projection relativePath(String path)

This projection can be used if you want the criteria to return a certain persistent field or a single-valued relationship field.

Please note that the path expression must be relative to the criteria this projection is added to.

Parameters:
path - relative path expression
Returns:
new projection instance

relativeGroupPath

public static Projection relativeGroupPath(String path)

This projection can be used if you want the criteria to return a certain persistent field or a single-valued relationship field.

This projects creates a grouping by adding the field to the GROUP BY clause of the query.

Please note that the path expression must be relative to the criteria this projection is added to.

Parameters:
path - relative path expression
Returns:
new projection instance
Since:
0.3

absolutePath

public static Projection absolutePath(String path)

This projection can be used if you want the criteria to return a certain persistent field or a single-valued relationship field.

This projects creates a grouping by adding the field to the GROUP BY clause of the query.

Please note that the path expression must be absolute meaning that it has to start with an alias created.

Parameters:
path - absolute path expression
Returns:
new projection instance
See Also:
CriteriaUtils.createCriteria(javax.persistence.EntityManager, Class, String), Criteria.createCriteria(String, String)

absoluteGroupPath

public static Projection absoluteGroupPath(String path)

This projection can be used if you want the criteria to return a certain persistent field or a single-valued relationship field.

Please note that the path expression must be absolute meaning that it has to start with an alias created.

Parameters:
path - absolute path expression
Returns:
new projection instance
Since:
0.3
See Also:
CriteriaUtils.createCriteria(javax.persistence.EntityManager, Class, String), Criteria.createCriteria(String, String)

rootEntity

public static Projection rootEntity()
Creates a projection referring to the root entity of the criteria hierarchy it is added to.

Returns:
new projection instance

distinctRootEntity

public static Projection distinctRootEntity()

Returns a projection referring to the distinct root entities of the criteria hierarchy it is added to.

You can get the same result by calling a combination of distinct(Projection) and rootEntity().

Returns:
new projection instance

min

public static Projection min(String relativePath)
A projection that returns the smallest value of a persistent field. The result of the query will have the same type as the specified field.

Parameters:
relativePath - relative path of a persistent field
Returns:
new projection instance

max

public static Projection max(String relativePath)
A projection that returns the largest value of a persistent field. The result of the query will have the same type as the specified field.

Parameters:
relativePath - relative path of a persistent field
Returns:
new projection instance

sum

public static Projection sum(String relativePath)
A projection that returns the sum of all values. The result of the query will be a Long (for integral fields), Double (for floating point fields), BigInteger (for BigInteger fields) or BigDecimal (for BigDecimal fields)

Parameters:
relativePath - relative path of a persistent field
Returns:
new projection instance

avg

public static Projection avg(String relativePath)
A projection that returns the average of all values. The result of the query will always be a Double.

Parameters:
relativePath - relative path of a persistent field
Returns:
new projection instance

count

public static CountProjection count(Projection projection)
Creates a count projection for the specified relative path. In most cases you can may use count(String) or countDistinct(String) instead of this method. The result of the query will always be a Long.

Parameters:
projection - nested projection
Returns:
new projection instance

count

public static CountProjection count(String relativePath)

Creates a count projection for the specified relative path.

Calling the method is the same as manually chaining calls to count(Projection) and relativePath(String).

The result of the query will always be a Long.

Parameters:
relativePath - relative path
Returns:
new projection instance

constructor

public static ConstructorProjection constructor(Class<?> type)

Creates a "constructor expression" projection for the specified type.

The caller must add child projections to this projection by calling ConstructorProjection.add(Projection). The child projections must match a constructor of the type supplied during creation of the projection.

Parameters:
type - The class to use for the constructor expression.
Returns:
new projection instance
Since:
0.3

countDistinct

public static CountProjection countDistinct(String relativePath)

Creates a "count distinct" projection for the specified relative path.

Calling the method is the same as manually chaining calls to count(Projection), distinct(Projection) and relativePath(String).

The result of the query will always be a Long.

Parameters:
relativePath - relative path
Returns:
new projection instance

rowCount

public static Projection rowCount()

Creates a count projection for the root entity of the criteria.

You will get the number of root entities matching the criteria as a result. Please note that you should use rowCountDistinct() to get the expected result the criteria creates joins on collection-valued relationship fields.

Calling the method is the same as manually chaining calls to count(Projection) and rootEntity().

The result of the query will always be a Long.

Returns:
new projection instance

rowCountDistinct

public static Projection rowCountDistinct()

Creates a "count distinct" projection for the root entity of the criteria.

You will get the number of root entities matching the criteria as a result. It is recommended to use this method instead of rowCount(), when the criteria creates joins on collection-valued relationship fields.

Calling the method is the same as manually chaining calls to count(Projection), distinct(Projection) and rootEntity().

The result of the query will always be a Long.

Returns:
new projection instance
